gradingSystem.title: Grading system
gradingSystem.deleteQuestion: Do you really wish to delete the grading scale?

general.title: General Information
general.explanation: A grading scale consists of grade steps that cover all possible percentages from 0 to 100. All adjacent grade steps should overlap on their boundaries (Example: grade steps (60, 70) and (70, 80) overlap at 70%). Which grade step includes that boundary is determined by the "Lower Bound Inclusivity". All grade steps also have either a name (1.0, Ausreichend, A,...) or a bonus point count (5, 10,..) depending on the "Grade Type"

gradeType.title: Grade Type
gradeType.explanation: A grading scale can either map directly to grades or to bonus points for the course or the final exam

inclusivity.title: Inclusivity
inclusivity.explanation: Determines whether a grade step's Min % boundary gets included and Max % boundary gets excluded or vice versa (Exception - 0% and 100% always get included in the first and respectively last grade step). Example: 60% score will be mapped to a grade step wih range 60% - 70% if lower bound inclusivity is set but not if upper bound inclusivity is set (in this case it would be mapped to the previous grade step)

firstPassingGrade.title: First Passing Grade
firstPassingGrade.explanation: Sets the first passing grade for a grading scale. Every grade with higher percentages will be considered passing as well
